title: Tom Brady's emotional response when asked who his hero is | GiveMeSport
text:
Tom Brady's emotional response when asked who his hero is Published 24/7 
Super Bowl LI will mark the seventh time Tom Brady has made an appearance in the big game, so you would have thought by now he would be used to the kind of questions he would be asked during the media week leading up to it. 
The New England Patriots quarterback was asked by a seven-year-old boy who his favorite hero is, as he is a hero to many youngsters around the world. 
The young boy and the media around him probably weren't expecting an emotional response to the question, but that's exactly what they got. You can watch Brady's response in a video further down in this article. SIGN UP NOW 
Want to become a GMS writer? Sign up now and submit a 250-word test article: http://gms.to/haveyoursay4 Article continues below 
In response to the boy's question, the four-time Super Bowl champion said: "I think my dad is my hero because heâ€™s someone I look up to every day." Brady then paused as he choked up as he held back the tears from his eyes. 
The quarterback was asked more on his father, Tom Brady Sr., as to whether or not his dad speaks for him. Article continues below
